author: Abdul-Aziz
inclusion_criteria: adult (≥18 years old) ICU patients and were prescribed doripenem for the treatment of sepsis (defined as presumed or confirmed infection with systemic inflammatory response syndrome manifesting in the previous 48 h)
exclusion_criteria: required any form of extracorporeal renal support, were pregnant or lactating mothers, or were known or presumed to be allergic to doripenem or any of the carbapenem antibiotics
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, scatter plots

author: Al-Shaer
inclusion_criteria: paediatric dataset: ages of 2 months and 18 years; adult dataset: 18 years of age or older, received cefepime, had cefepime concentrations reported as part of routine clinical care, and were admitted to the medical, surgical, cardiac, or neurological ICU between 2016 and 2018
exclusion_criteria: paediatric dataset: allergic to beta-lactam antibiotics or if they had central nervous system involvement, human immunodeficiency virus infection, cystic fibrosis, endocarditis, lung abscess, osteomyelitis, severe burns (≥20% full thickness), an infected prosthesis, an absolute granulocyte count of <500/mm3, or a serum creatinine level of >2 mg/dl; adult dataset: receiving renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: AIC, coefficient of determination of observed versus predicted plots for both population and Bayesian models, imprecision, bias

author: Al-Shaer
inclusion_criteria: ≥18 years old, were admitted to the ICU, and received cefepime 2 g i.v. every 8 h as a 4-h infusion while on CVVH or CVVHD
exclusion_criteria: pregnancy, cystic fibrosis, incarceration, admission for burns, and unmeasured or >400 ml of urine output in the last 24 h
other_samples: predialyzer serum, postdialyzer serum, and effluent samples
model_evaluation_process: AIC, highest coefficient of determination of observed versus predicted plots for both population and Bayesian, lowest imprecision, lowest bias

author: Al-Shaer
inclusion_criteria: dataset 1: adult ICU patients who received cefepime 2 g IV every 8 h via a 4-h infusion while on CVVH or CVVHD; dataset 2: adult patients admitted to the medical or surgical ICU, receiving CVVH or CVVHD, and received cefepime 2 g IV over 30 min every 8 h; dataset 3: ICU patients admitted to UF Health between 2016 and 2021, on CRRT, received cefepime therapy, and had cefepime plasma concentration measured
exclusion_criteria: dataset 1: pregnancy, cystic fibrosis, incarceration, admission for burns, and unmeasured or >400 mL of urine output in the last 24 h; dataset 2: pregnancy and incarceration; dataset 3: CRRT started after measuring cefepime concentration
other_samples: predialyzer serum, postdialyzer serum, and effluent samples
model_evaluation_process: AIC, highest coefficient of determination of observed versus predicted concentration plots, lowest imprecision, lowest bias

author: Alobaid
inclusion_criteria: age of ≥18 years, receiving meropenem (prophylaxis or treatment), and body mass index (BMI) of ≥18.5 kg/m2
exclusion_criteria: patients on renal replacement therapy, pregnant women, actively bleeding patients, patients with HIV or hepatitis
model_evaluation_process: VPC, coefficient of determination of linear regression of observed-predicted values, log likelihood values, bias, imprecision

author: Alobaid
inclusion_criteria: age of ≥18 years, treatment with piperacillin, BMI of ≥18.5 kg/m2
exclusion_criteria: renal replacement therapy (RRT), pregnancy for women, active bleeding, HIV infection or hepatitis
model_evaluation_process: visual inspection of scatter plots, coefficient of determination of the linear regression of the observed-predicted values, log likelihood values, imprecision, bias, bootstrapping, VPC

author: An
inclusion_criteria: adult ICU patients prescribed intravenous meropenem as the standard of care
exclusion_criteria: patients who were on intermittent dialysis or extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, receiving probenecid, or who were pregnant at the time of enrollment
model_evaluation_process: objective function values, precision of the estimated parameters, goodness-of-fit plots, AIC, VPC, LRT
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Asin-Prieto
inclusion_criteria: aged >18 years and needing to be treated with continuous venovenous haemofiltration for at least 20 h
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, goodness-of-fit plots

author: Barreto
inclusion_criteria: treated with cefepime at a stable dose and interval
exclusion_criteria: exposure to cefepime within the 4-days prior to the study course, received greater than one dose of cefepime prior to ICU admission, had acute kidney injury stage II or higher, were on kidney replacement therapy, or were cannulated for extracorporeal membrane oxygenation at the time of beta-lactam initiation, patient did not authorize their medical records to be used for research
model_evaluation_process: BIC, goodness-of-fit, between subject variability of population estimates

author: Bastida
inclusion_criteria: presence of cirrhosis, age ≥18 years and clinical indication for treatment with meropenem
exclusion_criteria: HIV infection, advanced neoplasm (except for hepatocellular carcinoma under the Milan criteria) and renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: clinical plausibility, significant decreases in objective function value, bootstrapping, VPC
covariate_testing_method: scatter plots, distribution of residuals, Bayesian shrinkage

author: Benitez-Cano
inclusion_criteria: age ≥ 18 years, diagnosis of nosocomial pneumonia and risk factors for multidrug-resistant (MDR) pathogens, and GFR ≥ 50 mL/min/1.73 m2
exclusion_criteria: allergy to β-lactams, previous use of carbapenems within 15 days, GFR < 50 mL/min/1.73 m2, severely impaired liver function (child-pugh C), obesity (BMI>30), pregnancy, life expectancy < 3 days, and colonization with pathogens known to be resistant to meropenem

author: Bhalodi
inclusion_criteria: received at least 3 doses of doripenem for any infection between February 2010 and March 2012
exclusion_criteria: poor candidates for blood collection, required hemodialysis or a continuous renal replacement therapy, or were diagnosed with cystic fibrosis

author: Boonpeng
inclusion_criteria: age of ≥18 years, confirmed or suspected bacterial infection, intravenous meropenem therapy, hospitalization in a medical or surgical ICU
exclusion_criteria: requirement of renal replacement therapy, pregnancy or breastfeeding, a history of meropenem hypersensitivity
model_evaluation_process: OFV, AIC, parameter precision, visual inspection of various goodness-of-fit plots, bootstrapping, VPC

author: Braune
inclusion_criteria: aged > 18 years treated with meropenem and receiving SLED during daytime
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: coefficient of determination of the linear regression, bias, reduction in the log-likelihood, goodness-of-fit plots, imprecision, VPC, normalised prediction distribution errors

author: Bue
inclusion_criteria: patients treated with intravenous piperacillin/tazobactam (4 g/0.5 g) q8h given as an IA over 3 min and requiring CRRT
exclusion_criteria: pregnancy, platelets below 5 × 109/l, international normalized ratio (INR) above 5, known allergy to benzylpenicillin or piperacillin, lactate >4 mmol/l, and the need for noradrenalin >0.50 μg/kg/min or the equivalent doses of vasopressors
model_evaluation_process: statistical goodness-of-fit, graphical evaluation of residual diagnostic plots, VPC, plausibility, imprecision

author: Buning
inclusion_criteria: aged ≥18 years treated with IV ceftazidime for a proven or suspected clinically relevant P. aeruginosa infection, and with at least one detectable ceftazidime serum concentration available during the course of therapy
exclusion_criteria: cystic fibrosis

author: Burger
inclusion_criteria: prospectively enrolled in a therapeutic drug monitoring study, which aimed to assess the clinical utility of measuring antibiotic blood concentrations (n = 30) or were included in the institutional TDM programme (n = 56)
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: bootstrapping, VPC, external model validation dataset

author: Burkhardt
inclusion_criteria: critically ill patients treated with ertapenem for early-onset VAP (≤4 days of mechanical ventilation). VAP diagnosis based on a new and persistent infiltrate on the chest radiograph, and two of the following three criteria: fever > 38.3°C, WBC count > 12 000 cells/mm3, and/or purulent tracheobronchial secretions
exclusion_criteria: child-bearing potential, pregnancy, lactation, a severely immunocompromised status, use of any antibacterial agent 4 weeks before study entry, a concomitant disease that may interfere with the course of the study, severe hepatic and renal impairment (CLCREA < 30 mL/min), drug or alcohol abuse in medical history, allergy to β-lactam antibiotics
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, likelihood ratio test, backward deletion

author: Carlier
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the ICU and prescribed amoxicillin/clavulanic acid
exclusion_criteria: <18 years of age, a haematocrit of <21%, absence of an arterial catheter or need for renal replacement therapy

author: Carlier
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the ICU and prescribed cefuroxime
exclusion_criteria: <18 years of age, a haematocrit of <21%, absence of an arterial catheter or need for renal replacement therapy

author: Chauzy
inclusion_criteria: hospitalized in the neurosurgery ICU with an EVD and with or without suspected meningitis/ventriculitis (> 5 leucocytes/mm3 and/or positive direct examination or positive culture)
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Chauzy
inclusion_criteria: ICU patients aged ≥ 18 years, mechanically ventilated, presenting early-onset (i.e. during the 7 days following hospital admission) pneumonia caused by Gram-positive and/or Gram-negative bacteria and a creatinine clearance more than 80 mL/min/1.73 m2 estimated by the MDRD formula
exclusion_criteria: renal impairment (measured urinary CLCR <80 mL/min/1.73 m2), one or more risk factors of MDR bacteria, septic shock, BMI >40 kg/m2, diuretic treatment, ceftaroline contraindications and suspicion or confirmation of pneumonia due to ceftaroline-resistant bacteria
model_evaluation_process: improvement of diagnostic plots, OFV, VPC, shrinkage

author: Cheatham
inclusion_criteria: adult patients who were hospitalized in an intensive care unit, body mass index ≥ 40 kg/m2, antimicrobial therapy for a suspected or documented bacterial infection, central venous access, and an estimated creatinine clearance ≥ 50 mL/min
exclusion_criteria: history of allergy to carbapenems, pregnancy, undergoing dialysis of any type, and hepatic dysfunction defined as serum bilirubin and alanine aminotransferase levels above the normal upper limit by factors of ≥2 and ≥4, respectively

author: Chen
inclusion_criteria: patients ≥18 years old; sex (male and female); patients who were administered imipenem after clinical diagnosis; patients without additional lifestyle risk factors, such as smoking; patients with or without ECMO
exclusion_criteria: blood sampling was not available at steady state after 4 doses of imipenem and/or all of the collected concentrations were below the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) and/or if patient before ECMO withdrawal
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, likelihood ratio test

author: Cheng
inclusion_criteria: ICU patients aged between 18 and 90 years old who were receiving piperacillin and tazobactam while undergoing ECMO for respiratory and/or cardiac dysfunction
exclusion_criteria: known allergy to the study drug, pregnant, bilirubin >150 μmol/liter, ongoing massive blood transfusion (>50% blood volume) in the preceding 8 hours, therapeutic plasma exchange in the preceding 24 hours
model_evaluation_process: VPC, normalized prediction distribution errors, R2
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, log likelihood, linear regression, backward deletion

author: Cheng
inclusion_criteria: patients aged between 18–90 years, hospitalised in ICU and who were receiving cefepime whilst undergoing ECMO for respiratory and/or cardiac dysfunction
exclusion_criteria: known allergy to the study drug, pregnant, bilirubin > 150 µmol/L, ongoing massive blood transfusion (> 50% blood volume) in the preceding 8 hours, therapeutic plasma exchange in the preceding 24 hours
model_evaluation_process: VPC, normalized prediction distribution errors, R2
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, log likelihood, linear regression, backward deletion

author: Cheng
inclusion_criteria: ICU patients aged 18–90 years who were receiving ceftriaxone whilst undergoing ECMO for respiratory and/or cardiac dysfunction
exclusion_criteria: known allergy to the study drug, pregnant, bilirubin > 150 µmol/L, ongoing massive blood transfusion (> 50% blood volume) in the preceding 8 h, therapeutic plasma exchange in the preceding 24 h
model_evaluation_process: R2, bias, log-likelihood ratio, imprecision, BIC, AIC, VPC
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, log likelihood, linear regression, backward deletion

author: Chung
inclusion_criteria: adult patients 18 to 65 years of age who were obese (BMI ≥ 40 kg/m2 or TBW ≥ 45.5 kg over their ideal body weight [IBW]) and hospitalized in an ICU or non-ICU
exclusion_criteria: documented allergy to any β-lactam antibiotic, history of drug or alcohol abuse, history of any seizure disorder, acute or chronic renal failure, renal replacement therapy of any type, or hepatic dysfunction defined as serum bilirubin and alanine aminotransferase concentrations ≥2 and ≥4 times the upper normal limit, respectively
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit plots, AIC, OFV, visual inspection

author: Cojutti
inclusion_criteria: critically ill patients who were admitted to ICU and received continuous infusion meropenem for empirical or targeted treatment of Gram-negative-related infections
exclusion_criteria: absence of critical illness, meropenem administration by extended or intermittent infusion, blood sampling inconsistency, and application of renal replacement therapy

author: Conil
inclusion_criteria: ICU burns patients in the secondary phase of their burn injuries with local infections or sepsis (empirically or targeted) prescribed ceftazidime
exclusion_criteria: allergy to ceftazidime
model_evaluation_process: bias, AIC, imprecision, OFV, Bayesian estimator

author: Couffignal
inclusion_criteria: male or female over 18 years of age; use of mechanical ventilation for >48 h; clinical suspicion of VAP (new or persistent radiological infiltrate and one of the following criteria: purulent tracheal aspiration or temperature ≥ 38.3°C or leucocytosis >10 000 ml−1); VAP with high risk of multiresistant bacteria (at least 6 days of mechanical ventilation or antibiotic treatment within 15 days)
exclusion_criteria: time between diagnosis and first antibiotic therapy ≥24 h; expected death within 48 h; creatinine clearance <10 ml min−1 or renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit plots, VPC, normalized prediction distribution error
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, BIC, bootstrapping

author: Crandon
inclusion_criteria: at least 18 years of age and had received at least 3 consecutive doses of meropenem
exclusion_criteria: deemed poor candidates for blood collection or required hemodialysis during meropenem therapy

author: De Jongh
inclusion_criteria: (i) a high probability of infection from nosocomial origin [body temperature >38 or <35.5°C not induced by external factors; leucocytosis or leucopenia; one or several suspected infection foci (based on X-ray pathognomonic image, purulent sputum, white blood cells in urine, or other accepted clinical sign)]; and (ii) no suspicion of an infection by Pseudomonas spp. or another temocillin-resistant bacteria
exclusion_criteria: (i) age <18 or >75 years; (ii) patient's weight <50 or >100 kg; (iii) renal insufficiency (estimated clearance <45 mL/min); (iv) haemodialysis; (v) estimated survival <5 days; (vi) documentation of temocillin-resistant organism; (vii) meningitis or other proven infections of the CNS; (viii) IgE-mediated allergy to penicillins; (ix) severe granulocytopenia (<500 polymorphonuclear leucocytes/mm3); (x) pregnancy; (xi) patients having participated in another study <30 days before; and (xii) retrospectively, marked deterioration of the renal function during the study period

author: de Velde
inclusion_criteria: suspected or documented severe bacterial infection and age 18–60 years
exclusion_criteria: eGFR < 60 mL/min (measured by the Cockcroft–Gault [CG] equation [25]), body mass index < 18 or > 30 kg/m2, and pregnancy

author: Delattre
inclusion_criteria: ICU patients diagnosed with severe sepsis or septicshock at their ICU admission or during their ICU stay. Severe sepsis and septic shock were defined according to standard criteria
exclusion_criteria: (i) age under 18 years or over 90 years, (ii) pregnancy or lactation, (iii) previous administration of any of the investigated antibiotics duringthe week before inclusion, (iv) chronic renal failure requiring dialysis and (v) allergy to any of the investigated drugs.

author: Dhaese
inclusion_criteria: Patients who were admitted to the surgical ICU and received continuous infusion of piperacillin
exclusion_criteria: Patients who received extracorporeal membrane oxygenation or renal replacement therapy during piperacillin/tazobactam therapy and patients aged <18 years were excluded

author: Dhaese
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the surgical or medical ICU and received piperacillin/tazobactam (TZP) in continuous infusion
exclusion_criteria: aged <18 years and those receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation or renal replacement therapy during antibiotic therapy were excluded from the study
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit plots, VPC, independent external validation dataset, LRT, AIC

author: Dhaese
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the surgical ICU and received meropenem as a continuous infusion
exclusion_criteria: Patients aged <18 years and patients receiving extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) or renal replacement therapy (RRT) during meropenem drug therapy
model_evaluation_process: VPC, goodness-of-fit plots, coefficient of determination of the linear regression, bias, imprecision, AIC, NPDE

author: Dinh
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the intensive care unit and got imipenem per clinical indication
exclusion_criteria: allergic to imipenem, <18 years old, pregnant or breastfeeding, or receiving dialysis
model_evaluation_process: AIC, OFV, goodness-of-fit plots, NPDE, VPC

author: Dreesen
inclusion_criteria: all adult patients admitted to the ICU with pneumonia and treated with ceftriaxone
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant women and patients treated with renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: OFV, VPC, goodness-of-fit plots, NPDE, bootstrapping

author: Economou
inclusion_criteria: (i) age ≥18 years; (ii) admission to an intensive care unit (ICU); (iii) clinical indication for TCC (only the combination formulation was available in Australia at the time of study); and (iv) receiving EDDf
exclusion_criteria: (i) pregnant women; (ii) patients with active bleeding; or (iii) patients with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection or hepatitis
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit plots, coefficients of determination, log-likelihood values, bias, imprecision, bootstrapping, NPDE, VPC
covariate_testing_method: stepwise linear regression, –2 log-likelihood value, goodness-of-fit plots

author: Ehmann
inclusion_criteria: presence of severe infection (confirmed or suspected by clinical assessment), age ≥ 18 years and therapy with meropenem
exclusion_criteria: planned hospitalisation < 4 days or meropenem administration > 48 h prior to study start
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit plots, VPC, bootstrapping, case-deletion diagnostics
covariate_identification: biological plausibility, previously published covariates, graphical evaluation

author: Eisert
inclusion_criteria: septic shock according to the SEPSIS-1 definition [18], being aged ≥ 18 years and necessity for treatment with meropenem, as determined by the treating physicians
exclusion_criteria: pregnancy and post-organ transplantation status. A termination criterion was a change in antibiotic strategy during the study period, as indicated by treating physicians
model_evaluation_process: OFV, goodness-of-fit plots, VPC, residual plots

author: Eyler
inclusion_criteria: ≥18 years of age, receiving CVVHD/F, and prescribed ertapenem
exclusion_criteria: pregnant and/or breastfeeding, had an allergy to ertapenem or another carbapenem, or had a severe, life-threatening reaction to penicillins or cephalosporins. Patients with a history of a central nervous system (CNS) disorder or who were currently experiencing a CNS infection were excluded as well. Finally, patients who were not expected to complete 24 h of CVVHD/F or who were concurrently receiving other extracorporeal therapies, such as extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, plasmapheresis, or intermittent hemodialysis, were also excluded

author: Felton
inclusion_criteria: Intubated patients who received piperacillin–tazobactam for suspected or documented pulmonary infection
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: log-likelihood value, coefficients of determination, slope and y-intercept from regression of the observed-predicted plots before and after the Bayesian step, AIC, VPC

author: Felton
inclusion_criteria: Study 1: 76 patients undergoing abdominal or thoracic surgery who received 2 g of piperacillin over 30 min; Study 2: 12 hospitalized patients, who had received 3 g of piperacillin over 4 h every 8 h were included; Study 3: 40 ventilated patients with ventilator-associated pneumonia, administered piperacillin (12 g or 16 g) by continuous infusion
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: VPC, log likelihood value, AIC, coefficients of determination

author: Felton
inclusion_criteria: Study 1: 13 critically ill, mechanically ventilated patients (4 patients were excluded from the analysis as they were receiving renal replacement therapy); Study 2: 40 critically ill patients with VAP
exclusion_criteria: RRT
model_evaluation_process: log-likelihood value, coefficients of determination, VPC, AIC

author: Fillatre
inclusion_criteria: (i) ECMO patients requiring antimicrobial therapy for sepsis;23 (ii) use of piperacillin/tazobactam; and (iii) the presence of an arterial line allowing iterative blood sampling for the PK study
exclusion_criteria: (i) pregnancy; (ii) restrictions due to rights deprivation, legal guardianship or trusteeship; and (iii) intermittent renal haemodialysis prior to inclusion
model_evaluation_process: -2 log likelihood, parameter accuracy, individual-weighted residuals, NPDE
covariate_testing_method: reduction of the unexplained variability of the parameters, Wald test

author: Fournier
inclusion_criteria: all burn patients admitted to the Burn Centre who received a course of intravenous amoxicillin administered either alone or in combination with clavulanic acid
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Fratoni
inclusion_criteria: Patients with presumed ARC in the medical, surgical, and neurosurgical ICUs (as defined by Cockcroft-Gault calculated creatinine clearance ≥130 mL/min within 24 h of dosing) were considered eligible. Additional inclusion criteria were: (i) male or female aged 18–54 years old, (ii) APACHE II score ≥10 and ≤32, and (iii) a documented or presumed infection as defined by receipt of another antibiotic.
exclusion_criteria: (i) currently pregnant or breast feeding, (ii) history of any hypersensitivity to a β-lactam antibiotic, (iii) history of chronic kidney disease or renal replacement therapy, (iv) suspected rhabdomyolysis or creatinine kinase >10 000 U/L, (v) any serum creatinine before dosing that was increased ≥0.3 mg/dL from the baseline used to qualify for enrolment, (vi) urinary output <20 mL/h for at least 2 h (oliguria) within 24 h before enrolment, (vii) sustained (at least 1 h) hypotension (systolic pressure <90 mmHg or mean arterial pressure <55 mmHg) refractory to vasopressor or fluid resuscitation for at least 24 h before enrolment, (viii) significant anaemia defined as a haemoglobin <8 g/dL at baseline, (ix) use of probenecid or imipenem/cilastatin within 3 days before study drug infusion, (x) current or anticipated use of valproic acid during study enrolment, (xi) acute liver injury, defined as AST or ALT >5 times the upper limes of normal (ULN), or AST or ALT >3×ULN with an associated total bilirubin >2×ULN, and (xii) planned or prior participation in any other interventional drug study within 30 days.

author: Frippiat
inclusion_criteria: age >18 years; diagnosis of late-onset (>5 days after admission) ventilator-associated pneumonia or hospital-acquired pneumonia requiring mechanical ventilation; and glomerular filtration rate (GFR) ≥30 mL/min (calculated according to the four-variable Modification of Diet in Renal Disease formula or by measurement of creatinine clearance based on 24 h urine) or acute kidney injury with indication for continuous venovenous haemofiltration (CVVH)
exclusion_criteria: pregnancy; life expectancy <3 days; allergy to β-lactams; GFR <30 mL/min and no required CVVH; previous use of meropenem within 15 days; and colonization with pathogens known to be resistant to meropenem

author: Garot
inclusion_criteria: at least 18 years of age, hospitalized in the ICU for sepsis, severe sepsis or septic shock, and treated with ceftriaxone
exclusion_criteria: patients with haemopathies or allergies to cephalosporin, as well as patients under guardianship, undergoing chronic dialysis, not expected to live beyond 7 days, or having been treated with ceftriaxone for more than 24 hours

author: Georges
inclusion_criteria: (i) an inpatient stay in the ICU, (ii) over 18 years old, and (iii) presenting with P. aeruginosa nosocomial pneumonia or bacteremia with a strain thought to be sensitive to ceftazidime
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Gijsen
inclusion_criteria: All adult patients admitted to the ICU, treated with meropenem and having severe sepsis or septic shock (as defined according to the definitions applicable at the time of the study) at the start of meropenem therapy were screened for inclusion
exclusion_criteria: pregnancy, do-not-resuscitate order, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, renal replacement therapy, decreased renal function defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate according to the Chronic Kidney Disease Epidemiology Collaboration equation (eGFRCKD-EPI) <70 mL/min/1.73 m2 on the day of PK sampling.

author: Goncalves-Pereira
inclusion_criteria: Infected critically ill patients requiring intravenous meropenem (by decision of the attending physician), admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) between May of 2009 and May of 2010, were recruited, irrespectively of comorbidities or of renal function
exclusion_criteria: patients receiving renal replacement therapy

author: Grensemann
inclusion_criteria: receiving meropenem for clinical indication and required CVVHD
exclusion_criteria: < 18 years or with an extracorporeal circuit other than the CVVHD

author: Hahn
inclusion_criteria: critically ill patients aged 19 years or older who were admitted to the CCU for venoarterial (VA) ECMO and were prescribed piperacillin-tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: use of drugs known to change the plasma concentrations of piperacillin-tazobactam
model_evaluation_process: OFV, goodness-of-fit plots, relative standard errors, VPC
covariate_testing_method: scatter plots, stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination

author: Hanberg
inclusion_criteria: Patients on ECMO treatment who were treated with meropenem
exclusion_criteria: Patients under the age of 18 and patients who were pregnant

author: Heffernan
inclusion_criteria: Study 1: Twelve adult patients in the ICU with severe sepsis and who received ceftriaxone; Study 2: 17 patients, not clear what inclusion criteria; Study 3: adult patients (age ≥18 years) admitted to the ICU receiving ceftriaxone intravenously for the treatment of sepsis with an extraventricular drain were eligible
exclusion_criteria: Study 1: Patients with suspected allergy or renal impairment (plasma creatinine >120 μmol/L at enrolment) were excluded; Study 2: not clear; Study 3: Patients who were pregnant or receiving either intermittent or continuous hemodialysis
model_evaluation_process: VPC, AIC, BIC, log-likelihood ratios, goodness-of-fit plots
covariate_testing_method: log-likelihood ratios, AIC, BIC, goodness-of-fit plots

author: Idoate Grijalba
inclusion_criteria: aged over 18 years, admitted to ICU, treated with empirical or targeted therapy with meropenem, and had received at least 3 doses of meropenem prior to monitoring
exclusion_criteria: All critically ill patients who had received renal replacement therapy
covariate_testing_method: AIC, BIC, scatter plots, RMSE, VPC

author: Isla
inclusion_criteria: (i) age >18 years; (ii) treatment with CRRT for >1 day for ≥20 h/day; and (iii) isolated or expected causative pathogen susceptible to meropenem
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: -2 log likelihood, stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination

author: Jacobs
inclusion_criteria: (i) diagnosis of sepsis or septic shock according to standard criteria (35), (ii) therapy with a standard dosage regimen of a broad-spectrum β-lactam (FEP/CAZ, 2 g every 8 h [q8h]; TZP, 4.5 g q6h; or MEM, 1 g q8h), and (iii) mCLCR of≥120 ml/min (so that all patients close to the threshold of ARC could be included in the study) on the day of TDM
exclusion_criteria: Incomplete TDMs (missing measured drug concentrations at T0 or T2) were excluded, as were TDMs performed on patients with burns or cystic fibrosis and those who were treated with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation. Patients could be included more than once.
model_evaluation_process: linear regression, coefficients of determination, VPC, -2 log likelihood, bias, imprecision, bootstrapping, NPDE

author: Jager
inclusion_criteria: Study 1: age between 18 and 80 years old, known or suspected infection produced by MSSA, hypoalbuminaemia arbitrarily defined as albumin plasma levels ≤32 g/L and without severe renal dysfunction arbitrarily defined as plasma creatinine concentration <170 µmol/L; Study 2: ≥18 years old, receiving one of the selected study antibiotic(s), would have received at least four doses of antibiotic by the time of sampling and were expected to remain on the treatment for the next 24 h
exclusion_criteria: Study 1: NR; Study 2: NR
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Jaruratanasirikul
inclusion_criteria: (i) >18 years of age and (ii) with a diagnosis of severe sepsis or septic shock, either at admission or during the ICU stay
exclusion_criteria: pregnant, had documented hypersensitivity to carbapenems, or had a history of chronic kidney disease
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Jaruratanasirikul
inclusion_criteria: aged ≥ 18 years with cardiopulmonary failure and were supported by ECMO receiving a 1-h infusion of 0.5 g imipenem/cilastatin diluted in 100 mL of normal saline solution, delivered via infusion pump at a constant flow rate, every 6 h for the treatment of severe infections for 14 days
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Jeon
inclusion_criteria: burns ranging from 1% to 81% of their total body surface area (TBSA) who were treated with piperacillin-tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: pregnant, breastfeeding, <18 years old, or allergic to penicillin

author: Jonckheere
inclusion_criteria: patients during the first 3 days of cefepime therapy
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV, goodness-of-fit

author: Kang
inclusion_criteria: adult patients (≥18 years) receiving V-A ECMO and concomitantly receiving meropenem
exclusion_criteria: patients who were allergic to carbapenem or pregnant were excluded
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV, goodness-of-fit

author: Kanji
inclusion_criteria: 18 years of age or older, admitted to 1 of the 2 participating ICUs, and receiving SLED and any dose of piperacillin/tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: hypermetabolic state resulting from >25% coverage of body surface area burn, cystic fibrosis or spinal cord injury, bariatric patients (defined as >150 kg total body weight at the time of recruitment), pregnancy, absence of a closed system arterial or central venous catheter (to minimize blood wastage), and concomitant therapy with probenecid

author: Kees
inclusion_criteria: Adult patients (≥18 years) who received continuous infusion of meropenem and were not on renal replacement therapy were eligible for study participation
exclusion_criteria: Not on renal replacement therapy
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Kim
inclusion_criteria: nosocomial infections, empirical management of septic shock from an unknown source, and prophylactic administration for patients undergoing ECMO
exclusion_criteria: a history of penicillin allergy or a positive skin test result for piperacillin
model_evaluation_process: OFV, precision, shrinkage of IIV, goodness-of-fit plots
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, VPC, bootstrapping

author: Klastrup
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill patients treated empirically or targeted with piperacillin-tazobactam, administered as continuous infusion
exclusion_criteria: treated with renal replacement therapy or extracorporeal membrane oxygenation or were under the age of 18 years
model_evaluation_process: likelihood ratio test, OFV, VPC, goodness-of-fit

author: Kois
inclusion_criteria: ≥18 years old, receiving veno-arterial (VA) or veno-venous (VV) ECMO, and receiving cefepime as part of their standard-of-care antibiotic regimen
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Konig
inclusion_criteria: The inclusion criteria were age ≥18 years and antibiotic treatment with ceftazidime in septic patients receiving sustained low efficiency dialysis (SLED)
exclusion_criteria: Patients receiving SLED at night were excluded for logistics reasons.

author: Kothekar
inclusion_criteria: We included patients aged 18–70 years of either sex, with known or suspected severe sepsis or septic shock admitted to the ICU and receiving meropenem 1000 mg 3-h extended infusion (EL) eight hourly (Q8H) as a standard of care. Severe sepsis and septic shock were diagnosed according to the American–European Consensus Conference (AECC) criteria.
exclusion_criteria: Patients who had received any carbapenem in the previous 72 h, those with baseline predicted creatinine clearance less than 50 mL/min [20] and those not expected to survive more than 72 h were excluded from the study

author: Krueger
inclusion_criteria: NA
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Kumta
inclusion_criteria: (i) age 18 to 85 years; (ii) EVD in situ; (iii) receiving meropenem treatment; and (iv) a diagnosis of ventriculitis or extracranial infection
exclusion_criteria: (i) small ventricles as determined by computed tomography with intracranial pressure of >20 mmHg; (ii) preexisting renal impairment, defined as the need for replacement therapy or a serum creatinine concentration of >200 µmol/L on the day of participant screening; (iii) preexisting hepatic dysfunction, defined as a gamma glutamyl transferase level of >200 IU/L; (iv) hypersensitivity to beta-lactams; (v) pregnancy; and (vi) patients in whom death was deemed inevitable within 24 h

author: Layios
inclusion_criteria: age > 18; diagnosis of ventilator-associated pneumonia (VAP) or hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP) requiring mechanical ventilation with a documented pathogen showing temocillin Vitek 2 in vitro sensitivity of ≤8 mg/L; and creatinine clearance based on 24-h urine output collection and measurement ≥30 mL/min/1.73 m2
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Lee
inclusion_criteria: patients (aged ≥19) who underwent ECMO for respiratory and/or cardiac dysfunction and who received meropenem for treatment or prophylaxis
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, VPC, bootstrapping

author: Lee
inclusion_criteria: empirical management of sepsis from unknown source, nosocomial infections, and prophylactic administration for patients undergoing ECMO
exclusion_criteria: Patients with a history of β-lactam allergy or a positive skin test result for meropenem
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, VPC, bootstrapping

author: Leegwater
inclusion_criteria: Patients aged ≥18 years were eligible for inclusion if ceftriaxone therapy was initiated in the ICU
exclusion_criteria: allergies to cephalosporins, <12 h life expectancy and the requirement for any form of renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: shrinkage, OFV, goodness-of-fit, IIV, precision, bootstrapping, VPC

author: Li
inclusion_criteria: Study 1: 1) adult; 2) admission to ICU; 3) treatment with imipenem and CRRT simultaneously; Study 2: All patients 18 years or older in the Firefighters’ Burn Center Intensive Care Unit at Regional One Health receiving I/C for any infectious indication and requiring high-dose CVVH were eligible for inclusion
exclusion_criteria: Study 1: Patients who were judged inappropriate to get frequent blood samples by the attending physician; Study 2: NR
model_evaluation_process: OFV, condition number, relative standard error, goodness-of-fit, VPC, NPDE, SIR
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, graphical exploration, empirical Bayes estimates

author: Li
inclusion_criteria: adult, admission to the intensive care unit, and simultaneous treatment with imipenem and CRRT
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, goodness-of-fit, OFV

author: Liebchen
inclusion_criteria: Patients with characteristics within the 90% range of the characteristics of the original dataset used for the PK model development were selected for the evaluation.
exclusion_criteria: Patients undergoing renal replacement therapy and patients with creatinine clearances outside the range of applicability of the MeroRisk-Calculator (25–255 mL/min) were excluded
covariate_testing_method: piecewise linear, power and linear relationship

author: Lipman
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill patients ranging in age from 18 to 75 years for whom the staff intensive care specialist deemed cefepime to be appropriate therapy were enrollable if they had an infected site as defined by clinical suspicion with or without positive culture results, systemic inflammatory response syndrome, and serum creatinine level of <0.1 mmol/liter
exclusion_criteria: renal dysfunction (creatinine clearance, <75 ml/min)

author: Lipman
inclusion_criteria: (a) 18-75 years of age; (b) infected site as defined by clinical suspicion with or without positive culture results; (c) systemic inflammatory response syndrome; (d) informed consent given by patient or next of kin; (e) normal renal function; (f) an intra-arterial cannula in situ
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Mathew
inclusion_criteria: Adult patients admitted to the ICU and initiated on meropenem at a dose of 1000 mg (twice or thrice daily) were recruited into the study after obtaining a written informed consent from the patient or the closest relative of the patient. Meropenem was initiated for the treatment of sepsis, pneumonia, polytrauma, complicated urinary tract infection, or as empirical therapy
exclusion_criteria: Patients who were on dialysis
model_evaluation_process: coefficient of determination, LLR, AIC, median absolute weighted deviation, MCS

author: Mattioli
inclusion_criteria: patients admitted to ICUs who developed a Klebsiella pneumoniae (KP) nosocomial infection treated with meropenem alone or in combination depending on the resistance profile of the bacterial strain, meropenem administration for at least 2 days, and bacteremia confirmed by at least one positive blood culture
exclusion_criteria: Patients undergoing dialysis procedures

author: Minichmayr
inclusion_criteria: Adult critically ill patients, who received continuous infusion of meropenem
exclusion_criteria: renal replacement therapy

author: Mueller
inclusion_criteria: age of >18 years, acute renal failure treated by CVVHD, anuria (<100 ml of urine/day), and treatment with piperacillin-tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: Patients with severe liver failure or cholestasis were excluded

author: Murinova
inclusion_criteria: age ≥18 years, not receiving dialysis, receiving intravenous meropenem to treat a serious bacterial infection defined as the development of potentially life-threatening clinical manifestations, and having at least one measured meropenem serum level in the course of meropenem therapy
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV, goodness-of-fit

author: Nandy
inclusion_criteria: In the phase 2 study of patients with complicated UTI or pyelonephritis, doripenem at 250 to 500 mg was infused over 60 min every 8 h. In the two phase 3 studies of patients with nosocomial pneumonia, doripenem at 500 mg was infused over either 1 or 4 h every 8 h.
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit, OFV, AIC, residual error variance
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, generalized additive modeling, OFV

author: Nicasio
inclusion_criteria: adult patients (≥18 years old) in the ICU, who were placed on the VAP clinical pathway and prescribed cefepime
exclusion_criteria: severely impaired renal function requiring dialysis and those deemed poor candidates for blood collection
other_antimicrobials: vancomycin, tobramycin (or a fluoroquinolone if tobramycin was contraindicated)
model_evaluation_process: LLR, AIC, coefficients of determination, VPC, bias, precision

author: Niibe
inclusion_criteria: admitted to the ICU between July 2016 to March 2018, inclusive, and who were treated with an intravenous infusion of meropenem and were receiving CHDF
exclusion_criteria: Patients younger than 20 years and those who declined to participate in the study

author: Niibe
inclusion_criteria: age ≥18 years, both medical and surgical origin of ICU admission between July 2016 to September 2017, and treatment with an intravenous infusion of meropenem initiated after ICU admission
exclusion_criteria: received renal replacement therapy or if they declined to participate in the study
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Nonoshita
inclusion_criteria: in ICU treated with DRPM, who gave written informed consent obtained from either the patients or their legally authorized representatives
exclusion_criteria: Patients who were administered other carbapenem antibacterial agents before administration of DRPM were excluded
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: O'Jeanson
inclusion_criteria: known or suspected infection of a critically ill patient in the medical ICU and treated with meropenem
exclusion_criteria: age (< 18 years old)
model_evaluation_process: OFV, AIC, goodness-of-fit, VPC, NPDE, precision, bias
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Ollivier
inclusion_criteria: (i) the patient was ≥18 years of age, (ii) the patient had a first episode of sepsis (defined as presumed or confirmed infection with new organ dysfunction in the previous 48 h), (iii) the patient had been treated with ceftriaxone for less than 24 h at the time of the assessment, and (iv) the patient had an expected ICU stay of greater than 72 h
exclusion_criteria: renal impairment (CLCR < 60 ml/min) and/or receipt of renal replacement therapy
model_evaluation_process: LLR, OFV, VPC, NPDE, PWRES, IWRES, bootstrapping, AIC, BIC, goodness-of-fit, RSE
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, BIC, backward selection, LRT

author: Onichimowski
inclusion_criteria: age 18–80 years, both medical and surgical origin of ICU admission, treatment with licensed doses of meropenem (1 g every 8 h), and clinical indications for CRRT due to AKI, determined in accordance with the criteria adopted by Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) recommendations
exclusion_criteria: diagnosed with HIV infection or terminal cancer, displayed intolerance or allergy to beta-lactam antibiotics in the past, had a high probability of bacterial infection with meropenem resistant strains, and received meropenem up to 3 months before being screened
covariate_testing_method: OFV, stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination

author: Padulles Zamora
inclusion_criteria: (i) sepsis with acute renal failure requiring CRRT with high-adsorbent membranes for >48 h; (ii) age ≥18 years; and (iii) isolated or expected causative pathogen susceptible to meropenem, prescribed at the discretion of the treating physician
exclusion_criteria: (i) hypersensitivity to meropenem or penicillin; (ii) neoplasia with metastasis and a life expectancy of <6 months; and (iii) pregnant or breastfeeding women
model_evaluation_process: OFV, AIC, bootstrapping, VPC, goodness-of-fit, precision
covariate_testing_method: univariate analysis, stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination

author: Pokem
inclusion_criteria: patients with septic shock, >18 years old, diagnosed with an IAI caused by a pathogen expected to be susceptible to temocillin
exclusion_criteria: patients allergic to any penicillin, including temocillin, pregnant or lactating women; or patients having participated in another experimental study with the same drug during the 4 preceding weeks
model_evaluation_process: AIC, VPC, 2LL, goodness-of-fit, bias, imprecision, shrinkage
covariate_testing_method: univariate associations, Bayesian estimates, forward inclusion, backward elimination, 2LL, goodness-of-fit

author: Por
inclusion_criteria: NA
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: LRT, diagnostic plots, plausibility, precision, goodness-of-fit, bootstrapping, VPC, NPDE

author: Rahbar
inclusion_criteria: age ≥18 years, admission to the Emory surgical intensive care unit (SICU) service for greater than 24 hours, and a diagnosis of sepsis that necessitated empiric antimicrobial therapy
exclusion_criteria: acute or chronic renal dysfunction (urine output less than 0.5 mL/kg/h or calculated creatinine clearance (CLcr) of less than 50 mL/min by Cockroft-Gault equation), pregnancy, known allergy to beta-lactam antibiotics, non-English–speaking, or if they were enrolled in another clinical trial
model_evaluation_process: bias, precision, LLR, coefficients of determination, goodness-of-fit, Bayesian analysis

author: Robatel
inclusion_criteria: treated by CVVHDF and receiving meropenem since at least 1 day
exclusion_criteria: filter clotting, sample timings/storage

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill adult patients with known or suspected sepsis in whom the treating physician deemed piperacillin–tazobactam appropriate therapy were conveniently sampled. Sepsis was diagnosed according to the criteria of the American College of Chest Physicians/Society of Critical Care Medicine Consensus Committee
exclusion_criteria: Patients with a known or suspected allergy to penicillin, piperacillin–tazobactam, or renal impairment (defined as plasma creatinine >120 μM/L)

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: known or suspected sepsis11 of a critically ill patient and normal renal function (defined as plasma creatinine concentration <120 µmol/L). Clinical indications for meropenem included nosocomial pneumonia, soft tissue infection, intra-abdominal sepsis and empirical therapy for sepsis without proven source
exclusion_criteria: NA
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: patients admitted to the Critical Care Unit with known or suspected sepsis as defined previously [28] and with normal renal function (defined as plasma creatinine <120 μmol/L)
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill adult patients with nosocomial pneumonia and a clinical indication for doripenem were included
exclusion_criteria: Patients with a known or suspected allergy to doripenem or carbapenem antibiotics were excluded
model_evaluation_process: OFV, visual inspection, goodness-of-fit, VPC, bootstrapping
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill adult patients with AKI receiving CVVHDF and a clinical indication for doripenem
exclusion_criteria: Patients younger than 18 years or older than 90 years were excluded, as were pregnant patients or those with a known or suspected allergy to doripenem or carbapenem antibiotics

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: acute kidney injury (AKI) and at least one of the following: oliguria, hyperkalemia, severe acidemia (pH <7.2), an elevated plasma urea or creatinine concentration, or clinically significant organ edema
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Roberts
inclusion_criteria: (i) age 18–80 years; and (ii) receiving cefazolin as prophylaxis for skin and soft tissue and bone infections after major trauma
exclusion_criteria: (i) absence of intra-arterial catheter; (ii) pre-existing renal impairment (defined as a plasma creatinine concentration >171 μmol/L or the need for renal replacement therapy); or (iii) a history of allergy to cephalosporin antibiotics or iodine.

author: Roelofsen
inclusion_criteria: ≥18 years and admitted to the ICU with an expected stay of >72 hours
exclusion_criteria: written informed consent was not obtained, if admittance to the ICU was due to burn wounds, or if cefotaxime therapy was discontinued prior to sampling

author: Rohani
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill patients with HAP admitted to the Medical ICU at Northwestern Memorial Hospital (Chicago, IL, USA) were enrolled between 30 June 2018 and 1 March 2021
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Roos
inclusion_criteria: Patients were enrolled if they had a serum creatinine concentration of <0.1 mmol/L
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Roos
inclusion_criteria: Twelve ICU patients received 2 g cefpirome every 12 h as a 3-min intravenous infusion. Patients were enrolled if they had serum creatinine concentration less than 0.1 mmol/l.
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Sakka
inclusion_criteria: ICU-acquired pneumonia (duration of endotracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation of >3 days) and normal renal function
exclusion_criteria: No patients with renal replacement therapy were enrolled

author: Sanches
inclusion_criteria: aged >18 years, with a confirmed or suspected infection with indications for use of the antibiotic piperacillin/tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: pregnant women, individuals positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or hepatitis B or C virus, patients with a known allergy to the piperacillin/tazobactam, patients who had previously been enrolled in this study, patients with serum creatinine >2 mg/dL or elevation superior to twice the baseline value

author: Selig
inclusion_criteria: NA
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Selig
inclusion_criteria: NA
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: LRT, diagnostic plots, plausibility, goodness-of-fit, bootstrapping, VPC

author: Shekar
inclusion_criteria: Eligible patients ≥18 years of age and receiving meropenem during their ECMO therapy were recruited.
exclusion_criteria: Known allergy to study drug, pregnancy, serum bilurubin concentration >150 μmol/L, ongoing massive blood transfusion requirement (>50% blood volume transfused in the previous 8 hours) and therapeutic plasma exchange in the preceding 24 hours
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion and backward deletiom

author: Shotwell
inclusion_criteria: Patients ages 18 years old or older who were receiving piperacillin-tazobactam with concomitant CRRT in the ICU were included.
exclusion_criteria: Patients were excluded if they were known to be pregnant.

author: Sime
inclusion_criteria: ICU patients, aged ≥18 years, were enrolled if diagnosed with a systemic infection known or suspected to be caused by a bacterium susceptible to ceftolozane-tazobactam
exclusion_criteria: Patients were excluded if they had renal dysfunction that necessitated the use of renal replacement therapy, had a known or suspected allergy to cephalosporins, had received piperacillin-tazobactam in the preceding 7 days, or were pregnant.
covariate_identification: biological plausibility as well as a preliminary regression analysis of each plausible cobvariate

author: Sime
inclusion_criteria: Adult patients (≥18 years) admitted to RBWH ICU who were prescribed CRRT were enrolled if diagnosed with systemic infection known or suspected to be caused by an organism susceptible to ceftolozane-tazobactam.
exclusion_criteria: Patients who were pregnant or had a documented or suspected allergy to penicillins and cephalosporin were excluded.
patient_characteristics: ICU patients receiving continuous venovenous hemodiafiltration

author: Sime
inclusion_criteria: Adult patients (≥18 years) admitted to the ICU were enrolled if they had an indwelling external ventricular drain (EVD) and informed consent was obtained.
exclusion_criteria: Patients were excluded if they had a history of allergy to penicillins and/or cephalosporins, they were receiving renal replacement therapy or had estimated creatinine clearance of <10 ml/min, and were receiving piperacillin-tazobactam or had received it in the 7 days before the time of screening.
patient_characteristics: ICU patients with an indwelling external ventricular drain

author: Stein
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill (Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation [APACHE] II score >10) adult patients being treated with CZA (ceftazidime/avibactem) were eligible to enroll into this study.
exclusion_criteria: Patients with a body mass index (BMI) >45 kg/m2, pregnancy, or with a creatinine clearance (CrCL) <30 mL/min were excluded.

author: Sturm
inclusion_criteria: Individuals were considered eligible for study inclusion if they were at least 18 years old, were admitted to the trauma-surgical intensive care service, had a BMI 40 kg/m2 or higher at the time of antimicrobial initiation, had piperacillin-tazobactam started for empiric or directed therapy as determined by their health care provider, and had available intravenous access.
exclusion_criteria: Exclusion criteria for the study were a creatinine clearance 40 ml/minute or less, penicillin allergy, history of type I hypersensitivity reaction to any β-lactams, documented resistance to piperacillin-tazobactam, absolute neutrophil count less than 500/mm3, or physician refusal.

author: Sukarnjanaset
inclusion_criteria: The inclusion criteria were (i) age ≥ 15 years, (ii) treatment with piperacillin/tazobactam, and (iii) sepsis defined according to the third international consensus definitions for sepsis and septic shock (Sepsis-3)
exclusion_criteria: The exclusion criteria were (i) peritoneal dialysis, hemodialysis or continuous renal replacement therapy, (ii) pregnancy, (iii) sepsis more than 24 h and (iv) known or suspected hypersensitivity to piperacillin/tazobactam.

author: Swartling
inclusion_criteria: Patients above the age of 18 years admitted to the ICUs and treated with cefotaxime for a proven or suspected infection were included in the study. Patients were included within 24 h from initiation of cefotaxime treatment.
exclusion_criteria: Pregnant patients and patients with treatment restrictions were excluded in the study. Additionally, patients on renal replacement therapy were excluded in this current analysis.
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion and backward elimination

author: Tamme
inclusion_criteria: severe sepsis or septic shock as defined by the ACCP/SCC Consensus Conference, with acute kidney injury (AKI) deemed by the treating clinician to require HVHDF, based on the presence of at least one of the following criteria: (1) oliguria (urine output <100 mL in a 6-hour period), unresponsive to fluid therapy, (2) serum potassium concentration exceeding 6.5 mEq/L, (3) severe acidemia (pH <7.2), (4) plasma urea nitrogen level above 70 mg/dL, (5) serum creatinine concentration above 3.4 mg/dL, or (6) presence of clinically significant organ edema (eg, pulmonary edema), and had an arterial line in situ
exclusion_criteria: known hypersensitivity to carbapenems or other beta-lactams, pregnancy, and life expectancy of less than 8 hours

author: Tegeder
inclusion_criteria: Thirteen consecutive patients who were admitted to the surgical intensive care unit, who were treated with CVVH for ARF, and who were receiving imipenem-cilastatin for the treatment of a severe life-threatening infection were enrolled in this  study
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Tegeder
inclusion_criteria: patients of the surgical intensive care unitwith severe life-threatening infections and acute renal fail-ure were enrolled in this study provided they were treated with meropenem and undergoing continuous venovenous hemofiltration
exclusion_criteria: Two patients were excluded: one because of interfering chromatographic peaks that made a reliable determination of plasma concentrations impossible; the other had polyuric acute renal failure with a residual creatinine clearance of approximately 24 mL/min and therefore somewhat different pharmacokinetic data

author: Thuy
inclusion_criteria: Patients admitted to ICU or general medicine department
exclusion_criteria: allergic to meropenem, <18 years old, pregnant or breastfeeding or on dialysis
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV

author: Truong
inclusion_criteria: aged ≥18 years with meropenem administration, ICU stay of >24 h, and a urine catheter in situ
exclusion_criteria: receiving RRT, plasma exchange, or ECMO prior to study enrollment
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, LLR

author: Tsai
inclusion_criteria: (i) Australian Indigenous; (ii) ≥18 years of age; (iii) confirmed or suspected severe sepsis within the previous 48 h; (iv) prescribed meropenem; and (v) an arterial line in situ
exclusion_criteria: (i) creatinine clearance (CLCr) <15 mL/min; (ii) requiring haemodialysis or continuous renal replacement therapy; and (iii) pregnancy
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit, coefficient of determination, bias, imprecision, VPC

author: Tsai
inclusion_criteria: (i) Australian Indigenous; (ii) ≥18 years of age; (iii) confirmed or suspected severe sepsis within the previous 48 h; (iv) prescribed meropenem; and (v) an arterial line in situ
exclusion_criteria: (i) creatinine clearance (CLCr) <15 mL/min; (ii) requiring haemodialysis or continuous renal replacement therapy; and (iii) pregnancy
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit, coefficient of determination, bias, imprecision

author: Udy
inclusion_criteria: between 18 and 80 years of age and were receiving piperacillin-tazobactam for the treatment of sepsis (defined as presumed or confirmed nosocomial infection while manifesting a systemic inflammatory response syndrome)
exclusion_criteria: (1) did not have an intraarterial line inserted as part of routine management (to allow repeated plasma sampling without additional venipuncture), (2) had renal impairment (defined by a plasma creatinine concentration (CR) greater than 171 μmol/L or the need for renal replacement therapy) or (3) had a history of allergy to piperacillin or iodine

author: Ulldemolins
inclusion_criteria: age between 18 and 80 years old, known or suspected infection produced by MSSA, hypoalbuminaemia arbitrarily defined as albumin plasma levels ≤32 g/L
exclusion_criteria: severe renal dysfunction arbitrarily defined as plasma creatinine concentration <170 µmol/L

author: Ulldemolins
inclusion_criteria: age of ≥18 years, a diagnosis of septic shock by the criteria of the Surviving Sepsis Campaign guidelines, CRRT, and an indication for treatment with meropenem
exclusion_criteria: severe chronic kidney disease requiring RRT
model_evaluation_process: VPC, bootstrapping, bias, imprecision, goodness-of-fit, LLR
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, LLR, Bayesian shrinkage

author: Ulldemolins
inclusion_criteria: age ≥18 years, MODS including septic shock diagnosed by the Surviving Sepsis Campaign guidelines criteria,11 AKI requiring CVVHDF and clinical indication for piperacillin
exclusion_criteria: chronic renal disease requiring dialysis
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit, LLR, OFV, Bayesian estimates, precision, observed concentrations, VPC, bootstrapping
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, OFV, Bayesian shrinkage

author: Ulldemolins
inclusion_criteria: Inclusion criteria were age ≥18 years, septic shock diagnosed by the Surviving Sepsis Campaign guidelines criteria, AKI requiring CVVHDF, and clinical indication for ceftriaxone.
exclusion_criteria: The major exclusion criterion was chronic renal disease requiring intermittent chronic dialysis
model_evaluation_process: goodness-of-fit, OFV, AIC, BIC, bootstrap resampling, VPC

author: Van Dalen
inclusion_criteria: All patients were on mechanical ventilation in the Intensive Care Department. After informed consent had been obtained, 20 patients were selected for the study
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Van Dalen
inclusion_criteria: adults on mechanical ventilation in the intensive-care department
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: van der Werf
inclusion_criteria: aged over 18 years with anuric renal failure, requiring CVVH and in need of antimicrobial treatment including the covering of gram-negative pathogens, as judged by the attending physician, were selected by the investigators among patients admitted to our Intensive Care Unit (ICU) with the consent of the responsible physician
exclusion_criteria: any evidence for contraindication, e. g., idiosyncrasy, allergy or other intolerance for the study medication or any other beta-lactam antibiotic agent

author: Vossen
inclusion_criteria: Only sedated and intubated patients 18 years old or older and in need of intensive care unit (ICU) treatment and renal replacement therapy were deemed eligible
exclusion_criteria: Exclusion criteria included a urine production of >500 ml/24 h and therapy with probenecid or valproic acid

author: Wallenburg
inclusion_criteria: Patients admitted to the ICU who were treated with flucloxacillin IV therapy were eligible for inclusion if they were ≥18 years of age and if they were managed with a central venous or arterial catheter to facilitate blood sampling
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Wallenburg
inclusion_criteria: All patients admitted to the ICU who were treated with intravenous piperacillin–tazobactam as part of routine clinical care were eligible for inclusion if they were ≥ 18 years of age, started piperacillin–tazobactam therapy ≤ 72 h before inclusion, and were managed with a central venous and/or arterial catheter
exclusion_criteria: renal replacement therapy or extracorporeal membrane oxygenation

author: Westermann
inclusion_criteria: Patients aged ≥18 years with sepsis treated with meropenem were eligible for study enrolment
exclusion_criteria: NA
model_evaluation_process: LLR, OFV, AIC, goodness-of-fit, VPC, bootstrapping

author: Young
inclusion_criteria: adult patients in the Intensive Care Unit who required ceftazidime according to usual clinical practice were enrolled
exclusion_criteria: history of allergy to cephalosporins, renal impairment (as defined by a serum creatinine concentration of 120 mol/L) or were already receiving ceftazidime

author: Zahr
inclusion_criteria: hospitalized in the intensive care units (ICU) at Pitié-Salpêtrière hospital. Patients were treated by cefiderocol in combination with other antibiotics for ventilator-associated bacterial pneumonia (VABP)
exclusion_criteria: NA

author: Zhao
inclusion_criteria: (1) patients admitted to the Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine in our hospital with a diagnosis of pneumonia; (2) use of meropenem empirically or therapeutically; (3) time of continuous medication > 2 days; (4) at least one steady-state plasma concentration could be obtained; (5) age > 18 years, and (6) gram-negative bacteria were isolated from specimen culture if possible
exclusion_criteria: (1) pregnancy and lactation; (2) allergy to carbapenems; (3) concomitant uses of sodium valproate; (4) incomplete dosing information or clinical data

author: Öbrink-Hansen
inclusion_criteria: Critically ill patients with known or suspected septic shock who required noradrenaline infusion and who were prescribed piperacillin-tazobactam (4 g/0.5 g) (Tazocin) by the treating physician were eligible for the study. All patients had an arterial catheter.
exclusion_criteria: Patients on renal replacement therapy and patients under the age of 18 years were excluded.
covariate_testing_method: stepwise forward inclusion, backward elimination, OFV
